titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: Another most glorious morning, but the cold was surprising. About noon it started to snow, & so continued until nightfall with much wind. I walked for an hour in the cloisters with Mary.
'. It is very charming & amusing. He is described in the Dictionary as 'the most distinguished of those who attempted to revive the cynical doctrines in the 2
century. He probably lived in the time of Hadrian.'
